The six consciousnesses themselves cease,
But due to being subsumed by the consciousness of the karmic predisposition,
Their power and function remain.
A question is asked:
Why is the consciousness of the karmic predisposition established?
Throughout one's lifetime,
It always takes a single object as its object.
If one is born in the human or heavenly realms,
This consciousness sees the rewards of pavilions and other such things.
If the six consciousnesses arise,
Their coarse functions cover and obstruct,
And one is unaware of the functions of this consciousness.
If one is born in an evil realm,
This consciousness only takes fire carts and other such things as its objects.
If the six consciousnesses that arise from karmic retribution are strong in their function,
then one will not be aware of this consciousness as a condition.
If the six consciousnesses of the desire realm take the desire realm as their object,
ordinary beings are unable to be aware of it.
Up to the formless realm, it is the same.
If the various consciousnesses of the formless realm cease,
then the function of this consciousness of existence will be revealed.
Like the ālaya consciousness and the mental consciousness.
Therefore, the teachings all explain the same.
The perfect realization is not one.

original: 不出三細六麁九相之法。
analyzed: 不出三細六麁九相之法。
translated: do not go beyond the dharmas of the three subtle [aspects] and six coarse [aspects], and the nine aspects [of consciousness].
As Shibi's commentary says:
It is like a single dream mind.
It is analogous to a single person
who suddenly falls asleep and has a dream,
seeing various things.
Giving rise to discriminating thoughts,
moment after moment without interruption,
in accordance with what is agreeable or disagreeable,
Deeply attached to them.
Doing good or evil.
Who are close or distant.
To those who are good or close,
One provides various benefits.
To those who are evil or distant,
One inflicts various injuries.
Some repay kindness and experience happiness.
Some repay enmity and experience suffering.
Suddenly waking up,
All the above matters are dismissed.
As for the one person,
It refers to the true suchness of the one mind.
Suddenly falling asleep
Refers to the sudden arising of unawareness.
Dreaming
Refers to the initial three subtle aspects of karmic consciousness.
Seeing
Refers to the second aspect of the evolving consciousness.
Various matters
Refers to the third aspect of the manifesting consciousness.
Giving rise to discriminating thoughts
Refers to the initial six coarse aspects of the characteristics of objects and cognition.
Moment after moment without interruption
Refers to the second aspect of continuity.
Deeply attached to what is contrary or agreeable
Refers to the third aspect of grasping and attachment.
To do good or evil, who are close or distant relatives?
The fourth is the characteristic of conceptual names.
To gain benefit or harm from good or evil
Is the fifth characteristic of giving rise to karma.
To experience the retribution of suffering and happiness
Is the characteristic of the suffering of being bound by karma.
Suddenly waking up and completely dismissing the above matters
Is immediately realizing that it is only the mind.
One attains entry into the luminous mirror of the mind.
Therefore it is said:
Buddha means
enlightenment.
Like waking up from a dream,
Like a lotus flower opening.
